sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The boaster bared, and his armour put off, without a conquest, by the quaking principle. In an answer to Enoch Hovvets, called Quaking principles dasht in pieces. / Written by James Nayler. Naylor, James, 1617?-1660.
[2], 12, [2] p.
Printed for G. Calvert, and are to be sold at his shop at the Black Spread Eagle, neer the west end of Pauls, London, : 1655.
The last leaf is blank. Annotation on Thomason copy: "May. 5". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[2], 12, [2] p.
Printed for G. Calvert, and are to be sold at his shop at the Black Spread Eagle, neer the west end of Pauls, London, : 1655.
The last leaf is blank. Annotation on Thomason copy: "May. 5". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
